ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | indistps2.a | |- ( Base ` K ) = A |
| 2 |  | indistps2.j | |- ( TopOpen ` K ) = { (/) , A } |
| 3 |  | #P_fvex | |- ( Base ` K ) e. _V |
| 4 | 1, 3 | #P_eqeltrri | |- A e. _V |
| 5 |  | #P_indistopon | |- ( A e. _V -> { (/) , A } e. ( TopOn ` A ) ) |
| 6 | 4, 5 | #P_ax-mp | |- { (/) , A } e. ( TopOn ` A ) |
| 7 | 1 | #P_eqcomi | |- A = ( Base ` K ) |
| 8 | 2 | #P_eqcomi | |- { (/) , A } = ( TopOpen ` K ) |
| 9 | 7, 8 | #P_istps | |- ( K e. TopSp <-> { (/) , A } e. ( TopOn ` A ) ) |
| 10 | 6, 9 | #P_mpbir | |- K e. TopSp |
\
 The indiscrete topology on a set ` A ` expressed as a topological space, using direct component assignments.  Here we show how to derive the direct component assignment version ~ indistps2 from the structural version ~ indistps .  (Contributed by NM, 24-Oct-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
